intro: Apium biternatum, commonly known as wild celery, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to greenish flowers in clustered umbels. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found near waterways or in wet meadows. The entire plant is edible and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
